verses.text: Praise ye the Lord. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power.

similars.text: I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the thanks and praise which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and preserved you, and has caused that ye should rejoice, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another--

Blessed be the name of my God, for his Spirit hath not altogether withdrawn from me, or else where is thy glory, for it is darkness unto me? And I can judge between thee and God; for God said unto me: Worship God, for him only shalt thou serve.
Lift up your hearts and be glad, for I am in your midst, and am your advocate with the Father; and it is his good will to give you the kingdom.
And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.
Thou shalt thank the Lord thy God in all things.
Blessed be the name of our God; let us sing to his praise, yea, let us give thanks to his holy name, for he doth work righteousness forever.
Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
And in that day thou shalt say: O Lord, I will praise thee; though thou wast angry with me thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.
That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

verses.text: Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness.

similars.text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy is his name.

And for his love he shall be great, for he shall be mine if he do this, saith the Lord. I have seen the work which he hath done, which I accept if he continue, and will crown him with blessings and great glory.
And what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe, according to the working of his mighty power,
To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.
He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:
That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.
Pray unto the Lord, call upon his holy name, make known his wonderful works among the people.
Let him, therefore, hearken to your counsel, and I will bless him with a multiplicity of blessings; let him be faithful and true in all things from henceforth, and he shall be great in mine eyes;

And it came to pass that when my father had read and seen many great and marvelous things, he did exclaim many things unto the Lord; such as: Great and marvelous are thy works, O Lord God Almighty! Thy throne is high in the heavens, and thy power, and goodness, and mercy are over all the inhabitants of the earth; and, because thou art merciful, thou wilt not suffer those who come unto thee that they shall perish!
And in doing these things thou wilt do the greatest good unto thy fellow beings, and wilt promote the glory of him who is your Lord.

verses.text: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.

similars.text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

And whoso treasureth up my word, shall not be deceived, for the Son of Man shall come, and he shall send his angels before him with the great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together the remainder of his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
And in that day shall ye say: Praise the Lord, call upon his name, declare his doings among the people, make mention that his name is exalted.
I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,
And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David;

For I will make my people with whom the Father hath covenanted, yea, I will make thy horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass. And thou shalt beat in pieces many people; and I will consecrate their gain unto the Lord, and their substance unto the Lord of the whole earth. And behold, I am he who doeth it.
And speak freely to all; yea, preach, exhort, declare the truth, even with a loud voice, with a sound of rejoicing, crying--Hosanna, hosanna, blessed be the name of the Lord God!
Blessed be the name of our God; let us sing to his praise, yea, let us give thanks to his holy name, for he doth work righteousness forever.
David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he then his son? And the common people heard him gladly.
That these plates of brass should go forth unto all nations, kindreds, tongues, and people who were of his seed.

verses.text: Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs.

similars.text: If thou art merry, praise the Lord with singing, with music, with dancing, and with a prayer of praise and thanksgiving.
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.
And he spake unto me, saying: Yea, and the most joyous to the soul.
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.

verses.text: Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals.

similars.text: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;
To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.
Behold my Beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased, in whom I have glorified my name--hear ye him.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
And he said unto me: Awake, and hear the words which I shall tell thee; for behold, I am come to declare unto you the glad tidings of great joy.
Yea, behold at his voice do the hills and the mountains tremble and quake.
And speak freely to all; yea, preach, exhort, declare the truth, even with a loud voice, with a sound of rejoicing, crying--Hosanna, hosanna, blessed be the name of the Lord God!
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

verses.text: Let every thing that hath breath praise the Lord. Praise ye the Lord.

similars.text: Thou shalt thank the Lord thy God in all things.
And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.
And speak freely to all; yea, preach, exhort, declare the truth, even with a loud voice, with a sound of rejoicing, crying--Hosanna, hosanna, blessed be the name of the Lord God!

Yea, and cry unto God for all thy support; yea, let all thy doings be unto the Lord, and whithersoever thou goest let it be in the Lord; yea, let all thy thoughts be directed unto the Lord; yea, let the affections of thy heart be placed upon the Lord forever.
Blessed be the name of our God; let us sing to his praise, yea, let us give thanks to his holy name, for he doth work righteousness forever.
How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.
And ye must give thanks unto God in the Spirit for whatsoever blessing ye are blessed with.
Sing unto the Lord; for he hath done excellent things; this is known in all the earth.

For the Lord hath heard thy prayers, and hath judged of thy righteousness, and hath sent me to declare unto thee that thou mayest rejoice; and that thou mayest declare unto thy people, that they may also be filled with joy.
Behold, my beloved brethren, I speak unto you these things that ye may rejoice, and lift up your heads forever, because of the blessings which the Lord God shall bestow upon your children.
